snippet: Gov. Gray Davis of California denied a clemency bid by a former Buddhist monk today, who is to be executed next week for two killings.    Governor Davis said remorse was not enough to justify clemency for the former monk, Jaturun Siripongs.  Mr. S...
lead_paragraph: Gov. Gray Davis of California denied a clemency bid by a former Buddhist monk today, who is to be executed next week for two killings. Governor Davis said remorse was not enough to justify clemency for the former monk, Jaturun Siripongs. Mr. Siripongs, 43, was convicted of killing the manager and clerk in a store in Garden Grove, Calif., in a robbery in 1981.
abstract: California Gov Gray Davis denies clemency bid for Jaturun Siripongs, former Buddhist monk who is scheduled to be executed on Feb 9 for killing two people during robbery in 1981 (S)

headline.main: National News Briefs; Former Buddhist Monk Loses Bid for Clemency
